addressleaf.section:
30 Martij
1593
M
r
Bodeley. to
e
LL
of the Councell
:
S
r
John Poleies
Horse band.
S
r
W
m
Reades
suite.

To the right honorable my very singular good Lordes the Lordes and others of her
Hig
es
privy Councel.

page.lettertext:
fol.74r
Maye it please yo
r
good LL. That whiche I had in
charge, by yo
r
LL. l
re
of
e 7 of this moneth, for
the company of S
r
John Poley, to be sent to
Ostende
, I
have proposed to this Councel, who also desire it very
earnestly themselves. But
e company being nowe
at
e siege of
Gertrudenbergh
, they make it a mater
prejudicial to
e countrey, to w
t
drawe them on
e soddain
and while they are in actual service. And though
ei
of themselves should be willing therunto, yet
ei knowe
that
Co. Maurice
will stay them for
e time. For
having taken
e Fort before Gertrudenbergh, whiche is
thought will occasion
e losse of
e towne, it is nowe
that
e Enemie must attempt their reliefe, and
at
the Count must continue his forces together. They
doe promise notw
t
standing,
at w
t
e first opportunitie,
when this action is perfourmed, or before, if it maye
be, they will send away the horsband: Wherof I
will not faile to put them in remembraunce, and so I
have advertised
e
Gouverno
r
of Ostende
.
To a second l
re
of yo
r
LL. of
e 4 of this present,
w
ch
I receaved sins
e former, w
t
one from her Ma
tie
to
e
General states
, in
e favo
r
of S
r
William Reade,
I can returne no present answear, not having deli-
vered her Ma
ties
l
re
, for
at there are no Deputies,
to fournishe an assemblie, nor no apparance of any
to meete a long time. In w
ch
regard I have advi-
sed
e messenger
at brought it, to repaire againe
home, for
e avoiding of charges: and as touching his
suite, I will doe in time convenient, w
at
is possible
for me, and procure from
e states in answear in writinge
w
ch
I will send unto yo
r
LL. and likewise to S
r
William.
fol.74v
But to impart to yo
r
LL. my
[humble]
opinion, I
doe ghesse by my conference w
t
a
[princ]ipall
officer
in this place, for
e accountes of
[.]
contrey, that
howsoever S
r
William Reade
[.]
great summes
of mony, they will make suche
[.]
, as it see-
meth in the ende, they will
[.]
in arrerages.
And thus in hope
at I have
[.]
yo
r
LL. heerin,
I most humbly take my leave.
From
e
Hage
. Ma
r
1593
Yo
r
LL. most humble
at [commandem
t
]
Tho: Bodley
